intro: [WRONG START] Embilia legnophylla var. legnophylla, commonly known as the red-stemmed embelia, is a shrub native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its slender, often reddish stems and small, opposite leaves that are typically elliptical in shape. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pinkish flowers, followed by small, fleshy berries that are an attractive red color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid lowland forests. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and has some traditional medicinal uses in local communities.
